programmes.show_description: The Flight of the Lapwing - Part 1. 1974. Stars Richard Wilson, Ian Marter & John Barron. The pilot and only survivor of a light aircraft crash is suing a relative of one of the victims for libel.
The Flight of the Lapwing - Part 2. 1974. Stars William Gaunt, Mary MacLeod & Christopher Benjamin. The cause of the crash was carbon monoxide, but nothing was found in the tissue of the dead.
The Flight of the Lapwing - Part 3. 1974. Stars John Barron, Mary Macleod & William Gaunt. Mrs Simon claims she knew the pilot was prone to epileptic fits. She calls him a liar and a killer.
1947. Western. Connie Dickson (Veronica Lake) plans to marry a sheep rancher, but her father teams up with land baron Frank Ivey to drive the man out of town.

programmes.show_name: The World of Budgerigars with Sid James
programmes.show_description: 1976. Stars Sid James, Patricia Burke and Philip Marsden. Sid learns of the joys of owning a Budgerigar in this very rare, 'lost' short film, possibly the last footage of Sid.
1963. Who Killed Wade Walker? Directed by Stanley Z Cherry. Stars Gene Barry, Gary Conway & Regis Toomey. Wealthy Wade Walker is killed when his plane blows up in mid-air.
1960. Dangerous Barriers. Stars Michael Ansara, Steven Marlo & Arch Johnson. Sam investigates when a rancher murders a local teenage boy's father in order to get his land.
1961. Romance. Director: Francis Searle. Stars: Emrys Jones, Patricia Dainton & Denis Shaw. The film tells the story of romance between a travel agent and a tourist on holiday in Italy.
Embarrassing Stories. 1976. Personal anecdotes as told to Dick Hills. This episode stars Roger de Courcey, Percy Edwards, Dickie Henderson, Vince Hill, Miriam Karlin & Sylvia Syms.
1957. Crime drama directed by Henry Cass. An American detective & Scotland Yard must work together to crack a counterfeit gang. Stars Wayne Morris, Karin Booth and Anton Diffring.
1954. Drama. Directed by John Arnold. Stars Diane Cilento, Lee Patterson & Duncan Lamont. Diane Cilento runs a caf√© in a small English town and is swept off her feet by a mysterious stranger.
1965. Drama. Director: Lance Comfort. Stars William Sylvester, Barbara Shelley & Elizabeth Shepherd. The wife of a blind composer plots to murder her husband after he learns of her affair.
Sinister Man. 1961. Directed by Clive Donner. Stars John Bentley, Patrick Allen & John Glyn-Jones. Superintendent Wills investigates the theft of some mysterious oriental tablets.
1960. Drama. Directed by David Eady. Starring John Gregson, Mai Zetterling & John Ireland. Richard, a factory owner, becomes blind during an experiment on the very day his wife wants a divorce.
1956. War drama. Directed by Lewis Gilbert and stars Kenneth More, Muriel Pavlow and Lyndon Brook. This is the true story of Douglas Bader, who loses his legs but returns to flight during WW2.
1943. Drama. Director: Maurice Elvey. Stars Rosamund John, Stewart Granger, Godfrey Tearle. Architect Hilary Clark decides to become a nurse. Follow her battle between her heart and her vocation.
1969. An insight into the life of Britain's top models, with a look at the rewards of the job.
Appearance in Court. 1962. Stars Joseph Brady, Brian Blessed & Dudley Foster. Catching a thief is only the beginning. Smith and Weir go to court and the truth is not looking whole...
Caroline Munro opens the Cellar Club by introducing the third episode of Supernatural, ''The Werewolf Reunion''.
The Werewolf Reunion. 1977. Stars Billie Whitelaw, Ian Hendry & Charles Kay. The surviving admirers of the Countess Ilona realise there is no escape from her isolated castle and night is falling.
Up next at the Cellar Club, Caroline Munro introduces ''The Terror''. This 1963 supernatural horror film stars Boris Karloff and Jack Nicholson.
1963. Horror. Director: Roger Corman. Stars Boris Karloff, Jack Nicholson, Sandra Knight & Dick Miller. A soldier loses contact with his unit and is forced to wander alone near the Baltic Sea.
Before wrapping up tonight's Cellar Club, Caroline Munro covers what to expect next week at the Cellar Club!

programmes.show_name: Hammer House of Mystery and Suspense
programmes.show_description: Black Carrion. 1984. Stars Season Hubley, Leigh Lawson & Norman Bird. Two journalists are hired to track down a famous pop duo from the sixties who unexpectedly disappeared.
2001. Adventure. Adapted by Adrian Hodges. Stars Bob Hoskins, James Fox & Elaine Cassidy. Part 1. An expedition leaves for the jungle where a man battles with dinosaurs and primitive ancestors.
2001. Adventure. Adapted by Adrian Hodges. Stars Bob Hoskins, James Fox & Elaine Cassidy. Part 2. An expedition leaves for the jungle where a man battles with dinosaurs and primitive ancestors.
John J Diggs. Stars Rhonda Fleming & Jack Kruschen. John J. Diggs appears to be scrounging from tourists in a Mexican town. But Margo Haley thinks there's more to him than that.
Appleby Fair/Ramming Time. 1986. The annual Romany horse fair in the Eden Valley and a sheep farm in the South Downs are the subjects of two more films from Jack's country diary.
1939. Western. Director: Raymond K. Johnson. Stars: Fred Scott, Jean Carmen, John Merton. The Colonel sends Fred Dawson and Doc Flanders to investigate a cattleman war.
Early silent animation made in 1935, charming hand drawn cartoon and story.
The Wedding. 1974. Stars Brian Coburn, Pearl Hackney & Nigel Havers. Lord William forbids his niece from marrying after accusing her of hiding Black Arrow, however her nurse has other plans.
1997. Stars Brendan Pollecutt, Fezile Mpela & Robert Finlayson. The two boys manage to escape the crash but back at base camp it is realised that the relics have been stolen.
Theft of Excalibur. 1956. Stars William Russell, Cyril Smith & Ronald Leigh-Hunt. A knight is held to ransom. The price for his release is King Arthur's sword, Excalibur.
Flop Goes the Joker. 1967. Stars Adam, West Burt Ward & Alan Napier. The Joker makes his move against the Gotham City Museum for a grand extortion scheme.
Strangers. 1954. Stars Roy Rogers, Trigger & Dale Evans. A group of outlaws on the run pretend to be surveyors. Unknowing Lanny Gaines lets the group stay with him and his ailing father.
The Mysterons. 1967. Stars Sylvia Anderson, Ed Bishop & Cy Grant. After a misunderstanding on the planet Mars, a war is started between humans and an alien race called The Mysterons.
The Bride. 1958. Stars: Conrad Phillips, Willoughby Goddard & Jennifer Jayne. Maddelenna is being forcibly taken to Altdorf Castle as a bride for Gessler.
Dan Tempest and the Amazons. 1956. Stars Robert Shaw, Joan Sims & Neil Hallett. A French pirate arrives in New Providence and attempts to sell seven women.
The Inquisitor. 1956. Stars Richard Greene, Victor Woolf & Archie Duncan. A visiting archbishop questions Friar Tuck following his capture. Robin and Little John work out how to rescue him.
1954. Sci-fi Mystery. Directed by W. Lee Wilder. Stars Peter Graves, James Seay & Steve Pendleton. An atomic scientist injured in a plane crash makes a claim that he was abducted by aliens.
1957. Action. Directed by Jack Lee. Stars Peter Finch, Ronald Lewis and Maureen Swanson. Two brothers join their father in Captain Starlight's (Finch) bushranger gang in 19th century Australia.
The Big Fish. 1958. Stars Robert Beatty, John Howlett & Richard Bebb. The success of a rank outsider at a race meeting nets certain people a small fortune to suspicion.
Episode in Bathurst. 1961. Stars Peter Graves, Chuck Faulkner & Joe McCormick. Cobb's stages are halted outside Bathurst until he agrees to pay toll to gunmen who have taken over the town.

programmes.show_name: The Sea Shall Not Have Them
programmes.show_description: 1954. War. Directed by Lewis Gilbert. Stars Michael Redgrave, Dirk Bogarde & Bonar Colleano. In 1944, passengers of a downed aircraft discuss their lives while awaiting rescue from the North Sea.
1960. Evidence in Concrete. Directed by Gordon Hales. Starring Russell Napier, Howard Pays and Peter Welch. A young girl's body found near a busy motorway tells of something sinister. (S1, E34)
Death in Mind. 1962. Stars Rupert Davies, Neville Jason & Anton Rodgers. A rich old woman and her maid have been murdered. Maigret allows the prime suspect to escape custody to learn the truth.
2002. Drama. Director: David Attwood. Stars Richard Roxburgh, Ian Hart & Richard E. Grant. Sherlock Holmes and Dr Watson investigate after being told an heir's estate is plagued by a ghostly dog.
1970. Horror. Director: Andy Milligan. Stars Gavin Reed, Jackie Skarvellis & Berwick Kaler. A family of vampires are searching for new blood since a inbreeding is destroying the family line...
1984. Stars. An entertaining short film about two women who are hitch-hiking with little to no luck until a kind truck driver helps them. The ride does not turn out to be as simple as it seemed.
